agntcy.identity.core.v1alpha1.Jwk.schema.description:
JWK represents:
 - a JSON Web Key (JWK) with the respective fields specific to RSA algorithms.
 - a Quantum JSON Web Key (QJWK) with the respective fields specific to AKP algorithms.

alg.description:
ALG represents the algorithm intended for use with the key.
 Example algorithms for Post-Quantum ML-DSA family:
 "ML-DSA-44", "ML-DSA-65", "ML-DSA-87".
 Some example algorithms are "RS256", "RS384", "RS512" for RSA algorithms.

d.description: The private exponent for the RSA kty.

dp.description: The first factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.

dq.description: The second factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.

e.description: The exponent for the RSA public key.

kid.description:
KID represents the key ID.
 It is used to match a specific key.

kty.description:
KTY represents the key type parameter.
 It specifies the family of quantum algorithms used with the key,
 such as "AKP" for post quantum algorithms
 or "RSA" for non quantum algorithms.

n.description: The modulus for the RSA public key.

p.description: The first prime factor for the RSA private key.

priv.description: The private key for the AKP kty.

pub.description: The public key for the AKP kty.

q.description: The second prime factor for the RSA private key.

qi.description: The first CRT coefficient for the RSA private key.

seed.description: Seed used to derive keys for ML-DSA alg.

use.description:
Use represents the intended use of the key.
 Some example values are "enc" and "sig".
